oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mechanism of drain disturb in SONOS flash EEPROMs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BHARATH KUMAR, P
SHARMA, RAVINDER
NAIR, PR
NAIR, DR
KAMOHARA, S
MAHAPATRA, S
VASI, J
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: electric charge
ionisation
leakage currents
semiconductor junctions
nitrides
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We investigate the mechanism of drain disturb in SONOS flash memory cells. Our results show that drain disturb can be a serious concern in programmed state and is caused by injection of holes from substrate into the nitride. We identify the key factors responsible for this to be band-to-band tunneling at the drain junction and impact ionization of the channel leakage current.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Proceedings of the IEEE 43rd Annual International Reliability Physics Symposium, San Jose, USA, 17-21 April 2005, 186-190
